website_summaries.verdict: Simple lens filter that's perfect for inexperienced photographers looking to try this technology for the first time.
pros: One of the best values among polarizing lens filters, although it may not deliver the longevity of some other options on our list
Models available to fit lens threads ranging from 52 mm to 82 mm
Uses multiple coats on the filter glass to try to reduce problems with glare that are common with inexpensive polarizing filters
cons: Tends to cause some problems with color accuracy in certain shooting conditions

customer_reviews.title: AmazonBasic vs Altura Circular Polarizer Comparision
customer_reviews.text: I bought both the AmazonBasics and Altura Circular Polarizer. Both are effective. I feel like the Amazon version threaded on to the lens easier. Possibly because the ring is considerable wider. There was no vignetting on a 24-105mm at 24mm with either filter. Attachment compares AmazonBasics, Altura and No Filter. Shot as Large Jpeg, no editing in post. To my eye, the Altura imparts a slight green tone. I liked the packaging on the Amazon version - the case has indentations/rings to keep the filter from flopping around when in the bag. Between the Amazon and Altura, I would select the Amazon version.
customer_reviews.author: Lars Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value. Great results
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a CPL filter for my trip to Sedona AZ and decided to give this a try. I am usually very satisfied with Amazon basics products so I thought it was worth the risk, especially with the low price. I was not prepared for how great this filter is. Sedona has some great red rocks and blue skies. With this filter on, I was able to filter out unwanted lights and get deep blues & reds. I did not get any vignetting or flaring with my Tamron 28-300 lens. I do not have any Wide lens, so I cannot comment on that. I have attached one photo from Sedona taken with this filter on.
customer_reviews.author: Shankar Narayanan

customer_reviews.title: Complete junk
customer_reviews.text: I really need to start sorting reviews by date before I purchase. I don't know if Amazon switched suppliers or what, but the CP I received is nothing like the CP spoken of in older reviews -- it's a lot closer to the 1- and 2-star polarizer of recent reviews. It barely cuts reflections, does almost nothing to enhance the sky, and generally does nothing more than darken my photo. I should've known better than to buy $12 glass, but I was enticed by all the good reviews that I didn't even notice they were years old. DO NOT BUY THIS FILTER. It's a waste of glass and a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: mike r

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: I went out and shot over 100 images of surfers with my 70-200mm f2.8 lens, which is tack-sharp. All of the images are soft and grainy...ruined and unusable. Set up my camera on a Bogen tripod and shot several images at all f-stops with and without this filter and every one with the filter are too soft to use. Inexpensive, but totally unusable filter.
customer_reviews.author: Gray Surfer

customer_reviews.title: At wide, its ok. At zoom (100mm + ), its crap
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. Amazon basics have been great deals; and sure this is a great price; however the low quality does not make this even a decent value. I have reviewed many items on Amazon; this is my first 1-star rating. Alas, this circular polarizer caused such bad blurring and really noticeable multiple edges to objects (chromatic aberration), that above 100 mm zoom, the photos were unusable . At first I thought the auto-focus on my camera (Nikon P900) was glitching; then realized it was the filter. Below 100mm was fine. In the included pics... the bird house was @ 850mm; the hummingbird feeder @ 600mm (cropped); the flower @ 60mm (cropped). Sadly I am returning.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley E.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for this price! Works really well. I have attached a video showing the polarization on a laptop screen and two pictures with and without the cpl filter. Camera : Canon SX30is
customer_reviews.author: Chark

customer_reviews.title: Dark and Blurry Pictures with CPL filter ~ UV Filter GOOD : CPL Filter BAD
customer_reviews.text: I bought the AmazonBasics UV filter for my lenses. I like those, but these circular polarizers are not good. Makes everything darker. Also, everything is blurry. When I first tried it I thought my lens was smudged or my lens was not focusing properly. Nope, I tested with other filters and without and can confirm it's this CPL filter. Look at the picture I've attached. The left image is without a filter. Right side is with the amazon basics CPL filter. You can noticeably tell the focus subject (tree) is blurry in comparison and I also had to up my ISO from 200 to 400 just to get a similar exposure.
customer_reviews.author: Jovana Muñoz

customer_reviews.title: Complete Failure
customer_reviews.text: The filter I received simply does not work as a polarizer. It does not work as a polarizer should. It did not reduce glare on water, or shine on leaves. I did notice that it would darken the sky, by unevenly, it would darken one side or the other of the sky, but never the whole sky. When holding up to an LED TV, I should see the picture slowly fade to black, it does not. When compared to name brand ( tiffen) filter, It is a complete failure. and of course I didn't realize it until the return date passed. Another failure of the "Amazon Basics" line of photography equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Hall

customer_reviews.title: TOP FILTER
customer_reviews.text: I purchased expensive one but it was blurry and have color cast, the Amazon one is amazing, very sharp and no color cast, I made the picture from 40 ft from my window late in the evening , work as expected , no color cast, sharp , of course you going to lose some details if you remove reflection but this don't blur out anything, reducing the glare will actually make the picture much richer in color, the best spend money ever, cheap and perfect, the reviews did says the truth . P.S you can leave it on your lens even if you don't need it, it will not affect the image
customer_reviews.author: Miss KayTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Thin enough to forget. Mine saved my lens.
customer_reviews.text: Unless you're very particular, this product is fine. I found no parallax, vignetting (although it will obfuscate), flaring or uncombattable reflection, importantly. At 20mm equivalent wide-angle focus it presents no corner oclusion. Rotation is smooth & fluid, but the actual polarizing effect is, anecdotally, quite lean. Which I expect contributed to the semi-scientific results reported by another reviewer, who noted somewhat higher light transmission levels in this filter compared to even more expensive models. Mine saved my lens but has a big surface scratch, which does flare. I'd buy another in a pinch, but I have a better one (not better by much, but...) and I'm ok with that.
customer_reviews.author: tkillam

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for high end glass
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why I thought a $20 polarizer would be any good but it will probably do okay for those of you not using L (or Nikon equivalent) glass. The attached image shows the affect this polarizer has on image quality. Top is with, bottom without. I took over a dozen shots each with and without on a tripod and picked the best 2. The image was shot using a Canon 5D Mk4 with a Canon 70-200 f/2.8 IS II lens.
customer_reviews.author: Brent D.

customer_reviews.title: Did not pass Polarizing filter test, sending back.
customer_reviews.text: Trusted the high reviews but what I received was not a "polarizer" filter. As soon as I unboxed the item i went to test it against other Polarizing filters and it does not cancel out the light when I sent them each on front of the other and turn the polarization to cancel light. The true Polarizing test, did not pass. Need to send this back, was curious why the low price, it was indeed too good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: Irv

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.  Spend money on a better polarizer
customer_reviews.text: This is not worth the money as it does not work. Please see the unedited photos. One is with the polarizer off and the other has it on. Both are unedited and straight out to the camera. This is one purchase where the Amazon brand does not live up to the standards they normally have. It does appear to be well made and sturdy. If you are just looking for it as a lens protector, I would say that it would work perfectly. It screws on and off very easily and again, is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Range

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Image Degradation on Specific Lens
customer_reviews.text: Image quality on a 70-200mm 2.8 lens was atrocious. Heavy ghosting and focus issues. May work better with different lenses, but for this specific lens, I will need to go with higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Noble Z

customer_reviews.title: Really gets rid of pesky water/sky reflections
customer_reviews.text: In actual use it gets rid of nearly all sky reflections and I could see the bottom of the creek. One has to rotate the filter while looking through the viewfinder to find the effect you want. I don't think I rotated it to the proper position to remove all reflected light. But it is till pretty good effect and makes the frog stand out a bit. This was my first use in the backyard. The sun has to be off to one side or the other for it to work. Long story.
customer_reviews.author: Chris N.

customer_reviews.title: Bad filter, but Amazon took care of things.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately for me, the filter I got didn't work at all. I got no polarizing no matter how I turned the ring. Which is too bad because it really does feel like a quality item. Considering the other reviews were all positive, I'm sure I just got a bad filter. Because this is an AmazonBasics item, when I went to return it for a refund, Amazon told me just to keep it and they would refund me. Okay Great! While this doesn't work at all as a filter, it does work as a cover to protect the front element, so, at least there is *some* use to it, so I won't throw it out. Picture Quality: 0/5 Build Quality: 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Kypros Nighthawk

customer_reviews.title: Good value filter for Very little money
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic polarizing filter. It seems at least as good as the budget line from brand name makers and marketers. It may have come from the same factory. It seems optically decent with good flat glass. The polarizing film is, however, a bit weaker than found on much pricier filters. That means that you might not see the full polarizing effect. Some will prefer that thinking that the full effect is harsh. It came in a useful square box which will serve as a storage box when the filter is not in use. CAUTION: The filter ring is very thick. It will almost certainly vignette on wide angle lenses!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Reader

customer_reviews.title: Affordable circular polarizer
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work very well but makes a little noise and has a gritty feel when turning. Maybe I got a defect, but since the noise and turning feeling doesn't have an impact on it's actual polarizing function, it's fine. Fro reference, I paid 5 times more for my first CP filter and it smoothly / silently turns, but is obviously way more expensive. I live in southern California and a circular polarizer is a must on all my lenses. I overall happy at this price for the filter and will probably purchase more.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Fixes one problem, but adds another
customer_reviews.text: Sharpness is compromised only slightly, but the biggest flaw is how it affects color accuracy in the picture. There is a noticeable yellow hue no matter how you rotate the filter. Shooting raw is fine since you can white balance it in post, but you would probably still have to use a white balancing gray card to make sure your colors are accurate. I used this for car photography to take the glare off the windshields and to make the colors more vivid, but ended up spending more time adjusting the color cast. I bought two of these for different sized lenses and found the same problem with both.
customer_reviews.author: Dave L.

customer_reviews.title: Really good budget polarizer.
customer_reviews.text: Now I have a much better polarizer than this, but I also have this in two sizes. Why, because it is 90% as good as my polarizer that costs much more, and I'm not worried about breaking it, having it splashed with salt water, sand, etc. Are these the best polarizers out there? No, but they punch well above their weight. I'd recommend throwing one of these in the bag to any photographer. Use it as your primary if you are on a budget, and as a backup/rough conditions polarizer if you've already sprung for a nicer one.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M. Fitzmaurice

customer_reviews.title: Almost Great
customer_reviews.text: Other filters that i have used on my Sony 16-35mm F2.8 G Master do not cause any black out in the corners or vignetting. This one causes a bit in the corners at 16mm. All is gone at 18mm though. I guess thats what I get for putting a cheap filter on an expensive lense. Image quality is good though and can edit out/crop the corners in post.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Another cheap Chinese product
customer_reviews.text: There are two issues with this product; 1) Overall quality; the filter screw is not well machined and binds to such an extent that it is difficult to remove once installed. 2) Yet another 'made in China' product. I would rather spend slightly more and get a quality 'made in Japan' Kenko filter. I will not be purchasing cheap nasty Chinese goods if there is alternative. In this case the Kenko product was in a different league.
customer_reviews.author: davidjluk

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I'm an amateur photographer and I've only recently started exploring filters. This filter was a great inexpensive introduction to the capabilities of circular polarizers. I've seen it's potential and usefulness in my work so I'm ready to take the plunge into more professional grade filters. This was a great set of training wheels. I don't regret the purchase at all even though I will be upgrading soon. At this price you have to expect to upgrade at some point.
customer_reviews.author: NicoNoire

customer_reviews.title: Serviceable
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect with my Nikon 70-300mm lens. The effect created by the filter is exactly what I expected, although I am no expert photographer. I will note that the filter does have tiny imperfections visible by naked eye when held at a certain angle to the light. These imperfections are located in one of the inner layers and cannot be cleaned or whatever. I have not notice this impact any of my shots, and they cannot be seen in photographs. Still, I know they are there and they bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Free88Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: DISASTER Blur 40x zoom plus
customer_reviews.text: To protect the lens I purchased and installed this filter with my Nikon p900 83 x optical zoom camera. All that time I couldn't understand why at full Zoom everything was blurry. It never occurred to me it was the filter until yesterday, and it's the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Loving

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't seem to do anything.
customer_reviews.text: My good Exus circular polarizer fell off my lens somewhere and this one had great reviews so I thought I would save a bunch of money and try it out. But no matter how I turn it or even hold it up in front of my eye, I can't see that it does anything or changes the light. I wonder if it is really a circular UV filter? Not expensive enough to return, but not useful either.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Wilson

customer_reviews.title: I was really impressed
customer_reviews.text: They say you get what you pay for - so being a little skeptical about the under $20 price point while other stores are pushing $120+ polarizers, I thought, well if it doesn't work well, I only loose $20/... nope this worked better than I had hoped - other reviewers were correct. this is one of the best polarizers out there when you are on a tight budget. the photo i took within seconds of each other, all settings same only turned the polarizer till the reflections disappeared .
customer_reviews.author: MStephens

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to compare it to, so I love it
customer_reviews.text: I take a lot of photos. I'm not a professional. I didn't want to spend $100 on professional quality, but I needed one of these polarizers. So worth it to me. I've taken some great photos on sunny days at the beach and at baseball games. Man I wish I had bought one of these sooner. I almost never take it off. I will say I notice if I zoom out 100% that around the edges I see the filter. So I have to adjust it back to 98% of my zoom. Not a big deal I crop the image out later if I really liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Donviti

customer_reviews.title: Scratches Easily
customer_reviews.text: After a few uses, the polarizer had several scratches. I don't even know how it got scratched. I usually forget to put the lens cap on, and just put the camera in my bag. There are no keys or anything that I would consider sharp. Only reason why I would buy this is to protect my lens. I purchased two, and sadly they are both in the same condition.
customer_reviews.author: San Mar

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Deals in Photography
customer_reviews.text: These Amazon Basics polarizers are excellent; the optical quality of the glass is great, they polarize as well as any other, and they're 1/10th of the price of filters with similar performance. This is the second size that I own, and they both work very well, though I use them very occasionally. They're cheap enough that I don't mind carrying them around when my equipment might get battered a bit, and if I get sand and grime in them and the rings start to lock up, they would be easy to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Gore

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Without a direct comparison with a more expensive model or two, I am happy with the results. Using with a Nikon 18-140 zoom and very pleased with results. A lot of reviews complain that the CP doesn't work, but fail to understand that the polarization works when the you are at some angle to the sun rather than straight on or directly behind you. It these scenario's the CP is not much more than a variable ND filter. The Amazon Basic series my not be the best, but its a handy addition to my camera bag for the occasional use it will get.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good for short focal lengths
customer_reviews.text: This polarizer works well for shorter focal lengths--up to about, say, 70mm. Around 200mm however, there's a distinct lack of clarity (and autofocus doesn't work very well), and once you get into the 500-600mm range, it looks like you're seeing through a sheet of tiny bubbles. TBH this is a problem with a lot of affordable polarizers, not just this one. Depending on what you plan to do, this may or may not be a problem, but you should be aware of it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Milligan

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a quality circular polarizer filter
customer_reviews.text: If you've looked for polarizer filers you know they can be quite expensive. The trouble is I love the effect on my pictures and I have to have one for each lens I own. This AmazonBasics filter is a value that is almost beyond compare. Why spend more, a lot more, when this filer does a great job of removing glare and improving overall color density. Just look at the attached test photos. Glare and no glare. It's that simple.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Price and quality are exceptional!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to use with my Olympus 12-45mm pro lens. Amazon Basics continues to surprise me with their less expensive options to other expensive gear. It just works! I hope Amazon continues to make high quality less expensive alternatives. So far all the Amazon Basics products I have bought have been awesome, or maybe I have just been very lucky! either way, I now look for Amazon Basics products before I make a purchase.
customer_reviews.author: P.W

customer_reviews.title: I can say this $10 CP hits the sweet spot. I'm not a fan of Amazon Basics ...
customer_reviews.text: While we no longer do professional photography, we're still very much very discerning about our photo gear. Having owned a multitude of Hoyas and Tiffens before, I can say this $10 CP hits the sweet spot. I'm not a fan of Amazon Basics products, in general, but this filter is an absolute steal at this price. Note: we did not have any of the issues some reviewers have criticized it for: namely poor craftsmanship and bad thread machining. Not to say they aren't real, just pointing out at least my copy did not suffer from any quality problems.
customer_reviews.author: Relentless

customer_reviews.title: Decent filter
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent filter but, unfortunately, it doesn't work on my 55-300 which I purchased it for. I shoot a lot of surfers and wanted to use the Polarizer to remove some of the reflections on the water but when I zoom in to max zoom it gets real blurry. I'm not sure why this is happening so I need to do some research. It looks fine on primes or zoomed out, just not zoomed for some reason?
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the Hoya and about 1/5 the price
customer_reviews.text: Wow. A fraction of the cost of my old Hoya filter that I lost. Much nicer colors. The Hoya left everything with an odd bluish cast. The Amazon filter on the other hand leaves the color cat much more natural, and the colors just pop with it. Way better than the Hoya and about 1/5 the price. Don't hesitate. Only negative is the indicators to tell you it is properly oriented are tiny indentations instead of more easily seen indicator lines, but for the price who cares?
customer_reviews.author: D. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great for landscape
customer_reviews.text: The product is relatively cheaper compared to other brands. This filter is great when you try taking photos of reflective surfaces like water or glasses. The filter itself is light and does not affect the quality of the pictures. I like how it adds another layer of protection to the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: this filter doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my wife and wanted to show her how it would darken the sky and enhance the contrast with clouds, help with taking the glare off things... it attaches well to camera but all it does is put 2 layers of glass between lens and envirnment, making things more likely to be blurry. There is no enhancement of sky or polarizing effect at all... complete trash. A nice lens protector but complete trash as a filter as it is advertised. Don't buy it...
customer_reviews.author: Lewis C.

customer_reviews.title: So Clear
customer_reviews.text: My pictures on the Smokies came out so beautiful and clear. Highly recommend for beginners and for someone in need of a polarizer.
customer_reviews.author: Dannay Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Scratches extremely easily
customer_reviews.text: The first filter arrived scratched. The scratch was not showing up in my images so I was OK. After I cleaned the lens it became scratched even more. I complained and Amazon promptly sent me a replacement filter. I didn't even have to send the first filter back. The replacement filter showed up and was unblemished. However, after a soft professional style cleaning the filter was scratched. I think the coating on this filter is too soft. Would not recommend ever.
customer_reviews.author: Ian McGrath

customer_reviews.title: DESTROYED FOOTAGE
customer_reviews.text: I've never posted a review on Amazon before - but this is going to be the exception because of how upset I am with this product. When filming a short, I used this polarizer on a couple of shots and while they DID knock out the reflections - they caused a MAJOR amount of static noise in the frame. Luckily, I removed the polariser for the following shots, but this still made this initial shots monsterously ugly. I think this wouldn't be so much of an issue if it were shot during a particularly bright scene/location, but I think a good polariser should be able to handle ALL applications.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Stuck on my lens
customer_reviews.text: The filter, itself, works well, but now that I want to take it off my lens, I have found that it's completely stuck. I've tried all the hacks online to try to get it unstuck, but it's not budging. This is my first filter, so I'm not sure if all filters have this issue, but it has been really frustrating trying to get it off, and I don't really see what I can do at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Bea

customer_reviews.title: Don't let it get stuck
customer_reviews.text: This is a good filter but because it rotates it can be hard to get a grip on. Be careful not to put it on too tight. If you put it over an existing filter they can easily get stuck together. I had to replace my first one because I could not separate them.
customer_reviews.author: Bravoking

customer_reviews.title: Amazon basics comes through big time here
customer_reviews.text: This is a great circular polarizer . As you'll see some reviewers have compared this one to very expensive ones and there is little to no difference. Put it on and simply turn the wheel and dial in the correct amount and area to polarize for your shot. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B.

customer_reviews.title: Great filter!
customer_reviews.text: I am really liking the affect of this filter. It screws on perfect and turns smoothly. I surprised a friend when I told him it was an Amazon filter. ******UPDATE AUGUST 2018 This filter likely saved the glass on my lens in an accidental fall. The camera fell out of my backpack when it came martially unzipped, and in doing so the filter shattered. This is why many people still use UV filters as protection, and this filter being $12 also fits that bill just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Blurry smeary images. Horrible.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this filter. All images taken through it are smeary and blurry. I threw it away. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Paloooz

customer_reviews.title: Great CPL for the price
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this CPL i was dubious that it would function. To my surprise the filter worked wonderfully. I would advise that you do not over torque the filter when screwing it on to the lens and you should slightly back it off from the tightest position to make removal easier. The lens cap fit the CPL too. The filter came packaged in sturdy cardboard and a padded plastic storage case for when it is not in use. I would not be surprised if the price of these do not increase in the future because of the good quality. If you are looking to get started with CPL filters this is a win that will not break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed - being returned
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful I would get the 5 star experience some photographers got with this. Unfortunately I got the opposite. This filter looks nice, feels sturdy, but is a piece of junk. I filed a return not even half an hour after opening. With this, it makes everything look blurred. So crisp lines. So disappointed! Will be upgrading to a pricier brand name.
customer_reviews.author: KMO

customer_reviews.title: Super Awesome Quality
customer_reviews.text: This did exactly what I needed it to do. I shoot automotive photography and this pulls out the reflections nicely. You don't need to spend the extra money for another brand when you can get everything you want from the amazon brand. It's not cheaper quality either.
customer_reviews.author: BLP3 Motors

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded My Expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant when I bought this because every other filter I saw was anywhere from $50+ and they say "you get what you pay for". With this filter, I feel like I got way more than I payed for! I was able to capture photos in the middle of the day without my lens getting blown out by the sun. Used this on my Canon EOS 77D with a Canon EF-S 24mm f/2.8 STM lens and it worked perfectly! AmazonBasics strikes again with a superb product!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Lomeli

customer_reviews.title: Good filter for the price
customer_reviews.text: This filter had a few (well, at least five) visible spots of missing polarizing film. The protective case it came in looked pretty sturdy, so I assume these were manufacturing defects that made it through QA/QC checks. At my amateur photography level, this filter works fine and filters polarized light sources. Plus, at the focal lengths I will be using this filter for, the spots will not be a factor (and for under 20 bucks you really can't beat it).
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: Why pay more?. This filter is as good if not better than ones costing much, much more.
customer_reviews.text: I don't see any difference with this filter than ones costing 4 or 5 times more. At one time or another I have used 3 other named brand filters on different cameras and lenses and this is as good if not better than those filters were. Very surprised at the results from the pictures I take and how well this filter is built.
customer_reviews.author: WayneF

customer_reviews.title: Great for Price.
customer_reviews.text: No distinct change between non-polarized and polarized, but as I got the spot fine-tuned the pictures turned out great. I use this for a summer league swim team that my kids belong to and the pictures I got while using this were much better than what the other parents were getting. Minimal sun flash, I was able to shoot from multiple angles. The camera (Nikon) was able to white balance without much variation. I was very pleased with the results. The only con was with initial set-up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best deal out there for a low profile CPL!
customer_reviews.text: Best deal out there for a low profile CPL! I have this one installed on a Canon 16-35 f4 L. I don’t notice much of a color change and it works as intended. It has developed a few small scratches in the coating from my careless cleaning but I’ll get another one at this price if the scratches get to be a hindrance.
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price and quality - Amazing Amazon Basics product
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good circular polarizer for the price. Great image quality. It clearly gets rid of the shades. You can get the smoothest shots with long exposures. I did a lot of research before buying this product but This is the best product at this price range. Thanks to Amazon Basics you Rock !
customer_reviews.author: Meghana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance of quality and price
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this little guy for the price! The packaging is nice enough to keep around for storage and transport, and the optics are clear enough that there's no discernable artifact in the images on my Fuji Xt10. Pair this with the AmazonBasics UV filter to cover the majority of your travel camera needs! I would not recommend this for professional applications as there is a little bit of a color cast and some uneven vignetting now and then. For everything else, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Scott ValentineTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works really well !
customer_reviews.text: Happy with use outdoors. Just rotate it slowly and note how it's reducing glare as you compose. The only drawback is the generic Amazon case/holder it comes in is a "one size fits all" with concentric rings for different size filters. The case just won't stay shut because of the lid design. Ever.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Great value and works well!
customer_reviews.text: Great value! This polarizer works very well and doesn't break the bank. I've seen some reviews complaining of color cast but I haven't seen it. Just works well and does a great job fighting reflections indoors and out. If you're concerned about colors, shoot raw or set a custom white balance. There, I just saved you 10X the cost of this filter.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fortson

customer_reviews.title: Wont unscrew from Step up ring
customer_reviews.text: I bought this CPL a size larger with hope that I could use it with 2 of my lenses. The problem I had immediately is that once I screwed the filter onto the step up ring... It won't unscrew. It seems to me that the threading is not deep enough to where it will catch to the step up ring to allow it to come off (it just spins).
customer_reviews.author: John Lehmann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent on all levels
customer_reviews.text: Excellent companion to the UV filter. Great as a stand alone, but don't be afraid to mix and match your filters to get that special effect you are trying to create.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E Rubin

customer_reviews.title: Great filter for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this filter. A lot of photographers will say you should spend five times as much or it’s not good. I am not trying to be Amsel Adams, I am just trying to take some nice photos and this is fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S. Szymczak

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Lens, Should Come With A Simple 1 Page Guide For Newbies But Most Likely Will Figure It Out.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, at first i didnt quite know how to install it on my lens but then i noticed that i had it going on the wrong way. haha Yes im new-ish to photography and yes i know i need to clean my camera, i bought a camera cleaning kit with this. Hopefully from the picture you can understand how to install it, simply place like so and turn clockwise and go shoot some dope photos.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price for lens protection
customer_reviews.text: Good price for lens protection. There are substantially more expensive UV filters (which I have on some very expensive lenses), but to protect the front glass, this does the job. When I buy a lens the first thing I do is put away the lens cap and put on a UV filter and hood. I have never damaged the front glass of a lens in 45 years. (I hate lens caps, they are just good for getting lost).
customer_reviews.author: Chris Record

customer_reviews.title: Very poor results
customer_reviews.text: I organdy purchased this filter for shooting cars. It is know that cars can have very bad reflections and most photographers use a CPL filter to counter act this. Well I had very poor results and it barely cut down on the reflections in my pictures. Very disappointed and the reviews I read to not match my experience at all.
customer_reviews.author: bseligson

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't really work. Handholding my polarized sunglasses in front of the lens does a better job (though not perfect). Edit (after trying a few more times): It produces more distortion along the edges of the frame. Not just that but also some unnatural color changes and also reduced sharpness even in brightly lit conditions
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I had a circular polarizer from another well known brand that broke. It stopped spinning freely after about 2 years of use. For the price of this compared to the popular brand, I could not say no! I’m so glad because quality is just as good to my amateur eye, and it saved me a lot of money. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen M

customer_reviews.title: Might be cheap, but still not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Feels well built and is very inexpensive, but that's about the only positives. Any cropping or enlarging and the images get pretty soft. Also left what looked like green chromatic aberration around edges. My first impulse was that the price was unbeatable and I could put up with some shortcomings, but it is pretty unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I've been meaning to buy a polarizer in this size for awhile. Not regrets with this purchase. The glass is excellent and works as expected. I plan on using it for some shots from of the salmon running in the river in about a month. Polarized lenses just make them stand right out from above
customer_reviews.author: Derek S.

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: To be completely honest this is the second one I purchased, I returned the first one because it did not polarize at all, no change no matter what angle to the sun or direction of polarizing plates. This one does work however the amount of change is still minimal compared to other polarizers that I have. I meant Amazon basic fan but this is not their best product
customer_reviews.author: Deanglin

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had a chance to use this filter a few time now and find it works pretty good for direct sunlight including sunsets. I have not seen any drawbacks at this point and consider it a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Swick

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my D5600
customer_reviews.text: Works well with my D5600 lens. Used it a couple times and can really remove the glare and provide sharper images.
customer_reviews.author: Andy A

customer_reviews.title: Point, Shoot and Enjoy!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about using filters, but once I used this one. I loved the polarized effects! Keep this in mind for future users. If you have a camera that has a lens that shows the threads on the outside then order up a size my T3i lens is 55mm and it took a 58mm filter lens to fit.
customer_reviews.author: TN NeNe

customer_reviews.title: Great for photographing birds
customer_reviews.text: I mainly photograph waterfowl and this lens filter is great for reducing reflections on the water, and or snow. Your lens cap will also still be able to snap on to the lens, (which I wasn't sure about) as I just got my new DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: M. S.

customer_reviews.title: As good as much more expensive alternatives.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Nikon 18-140 zoom lens. Great quality polarizer. I ran it through its paces taking various photos that included sky and reflective foliage. It performed exactly as I expected based on previous experience from a more expensive but smaller polarizer from my film days.
customer_reviews.author: David N

customer_reviews.title: Lower rating
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that this filter does not accept a lens cap. UPDATE-Also the threads are very sparse so its hard to get a secure mount. I thought it was mounted, took it outside, and the lens was gone. It was not handled roughly but it fell off. Guess you get what you pay for, but now I don't even have what i paid for. Very poor.
customer_reviews.author: R. Taormina

customer_reviews.title: Filters don't do a thing!
customer_reviews.text: These circular polarizer filters do absolutely nothing. Not matter in which direction they are turned or in which position the filters are placed, there is no effect to the image. I can hold them and look through them while I rotate them and hold them up....there is no change. I have another brand and it works perfectly. I got these because of the sizes needed. Never again. The only reason I have them a ONE STAR is because I couldn't submit a ZERO.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Works ok except for 1 big problem.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine except for one big problem. It doesn’t screw on completely to my Sony lens, so turning it to adjust polarization direction also unscrews the lens with the possibility of it falling off.
customer_reviews.author: David Coblitz

customer_reviews.title: Good but dont open box for a gift!
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Only issue was that if you are giving it as a gift do not open the box it was shipped in. It is the actual box so you would be openning the present with the label that says what it is (which was covered with shipping label). It would be better if amazon could put sticker with the specifications on the little plastic case the lense comes in so it looks like new for a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and deep colors as a result
customer_reviews.text: VIGNETTING! Be Advised - You will most likely experience vignetting in the corners of your shot. I am using an 11m - 24m lens; at 11m, I had to zoom in just a tad over 12m to eliminate the vignetting . This is just a heads up to those who may not want to sacrifice that 1m, or, if you run and gun and you don't want to worry about checking each shot! It's a matter of preference. See photo- Works perfectly! Beautiful and deep colors as a result! I hope this is helpful to others! YouTube CaliKim29
customer_reviews.author: CaliKim

customer_reviews.title: Quality Item at an Excellent Price
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with my purchase of AmazonBasics Circular Polarizer Camera Photography Lens. worked better than expected regarding picture quality and landscape related photography. A definite recommendation on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Truer Reviewer 2019

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: Not bad and for the price definitely a great choice. Shot with a canon rebel t6i
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT SCREW THIS ON TIGHT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I did not pay attention to the other reviews, and boy do I regret it. I put it on to try it out and could not get it off. We were going somewhere that would require both indoor and outdoor pictures. Indoor was useless because I could not get it off. Finally, after we got home, I was able to take a pair of plyers to it and get it off.
customer_reviews.author: J. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Removing it IS a problem.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because of the good price, however, I was concerned about the issues with the filter getting stuck on lenses. Because of this, I was VERY cautious to LIGHTLY tighten the polarizer on my Canon 18-135 lens. I ONLY tightened it enough so that it would not spin off when rotating the outer layer. Having done this, when I went to remove the polarizer for a dark indoor concert, IT WOULD NOT COME OFF. It took two of us 10 minutes of manipulating to get this off my lens. I promptly returned it. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.
customer_reviews.author: R Erwin

customer_reviews.title: Adds A Yellow Cast
customer_reviews.text: The price is really attractive. But the filter does not do the job, as it produces minimal polarizing effect, but has a yellowing effect. Not acceptable for serious photography. I should know better than to put a $17 filter on a $2000 G Master lens!
customer_reviews.author: Nottingham

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: For $15, I'd say this is a great deal. It does add a bit of yellow to the image, but you can correct that in post with the click of the mouse button. As for sharpness, it slightly degrades the image. If you're not a pixel peeper, you'll probably never see the difference.
customer_reviews.author: ShoelessTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Well made, good price, and high quality glass.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and high quality glass. All my UV filters are B+W, and based on the reviews I opted for AmazonBasics polarizer. As others mentioned, if tightened too tight it is hard to remove, but if too light, then rotating the polarizing density will unscrew the filter:) I attached it on top of my UV filter (yes, two filters may deteriorate the quality of the image, but not perceivable so far). That way it is tightly screwed, and the lens ring is not being damaged. It does take practice using such filter, as you need be 90 deg to the sun, but skies are bluer and shooting thru windows is more pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I RECOMMEND THIS FILTER!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this 58 mm polarizer filter for my Canon rebel T7i DSLR camera. Other than the branding, you couldn't much difference at all from Tiffen, Canon, or other filters in the market. The price point is phenomenal. It performs just as expected, for a better price, without sacrificing quality. A MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael P.

customer_reviews.title: It just fell apart
customer_reviews.text: I pulled my camera out of the bag and the polarizer just literally fell apart. There was a ring and the lens at the bottom of the bag. It worked great before that.
customer_reviews.author: Susi

customer_reviews.title: Ruined a lot of shots ... blurred the images
customer_reviews.text: Even though it intensified the sky it blurred all of my shots with my D5300 ... will be sending that lens filter back. Ruined an entire day of bird shots, I'm so disappointed! The images I posted are just to show the blur ... look at the word "Airstream" in both images, enough said!
customer_reviews.author: Discovery

customer_reviews.title: A great first polarizer!
customer_reviews.text: A great first polarizer. It works! It’s cheap as dirt but it’s nice quality! Add these to your kit if you’re interested in polarizers but don’t want to put out a ton of money for your first one. Image sharpness is diminished only slightly. A higher quality polarizer would likely provide a sharper image but it’s definitely not a dealbreaker.
customer_reviews.author: Cory G

customer_reviews.title: Operable solution
customer_reviews.text: I needed a big Circular Polarizer for one of my lenses, and this fit the bill. I will be giving it a test soon and if there are any issues, I will adjust accordingly. The price was right and the other reviews were satisfactory for me to give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Lane Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Insufficient polarization for my need.
customer_reviews.text: As this is being written this is en route back to Amazon for refund. These are very weak polarizing filters, not capable of full polarization. Even with two filters stacked and crossed there is only minimal light reduction. Depending on the angle they appear to let in more yellow light or blue light.
customer_reviews.author: invisibleTop Contributor: The Lord of the Rings

customer_reviews.title: Female 67mm threads would not thread on to the male 67mm mount.
customer_reviews.text: The female 67mm threads would not thread on to the male 67mm mount. Frustrating! Thank you for the '1 star experience' Amazon Basics.
customer_reviews.author: A.W.

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Better than some others that cost two or three times as much. It's a little thick but I didn't notice any major vignetting and having a thicker ring makes adjustments easier anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value
customer_reviews.text: Just compared this to a $145 filter from Nikon. While the Nikon attaches and twirls more easily than this "basics" filter, the actual polarization is indistinguishable, at least to my eyes. Therefore: excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Auburn

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but keeping it.
customer_reviews.text: Tiny scratch Mark on lens, but can't see how it affects photos at 100% So, I'll keep I and hope it remains insignificant in future.
customer_reviews.author: R. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY! CHEAP AND HORRIBLE QUALITY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this polarized lens and the image quality is HORRIBLE, not to mention that lens has a terrible polarized filter, you are better off purchasing another polarizer from another company. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: INFRAOVENS

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a add on for my 50mm 1.4f Nikon lens and it is a must have for a natural light photographer. It definitely helps with glare and is a great add on that doesn't distort picture color. Even if you have a lens hood; I would still recommend getting the polarized lens cover as it provides anti glair far better than the lens hood.
customer_reviews.author: Ninette

customer_reviews.title: Broke before I could use.
customer_reviews.text: I sat on it while i was on vacation and it was broken into pieces before i could ever use :( ..so i cant review it for the functionily. It is probably cheaply made as it broke so quickly. I will give the benefit of the doubt to the product features though.
customer_reviews.author: RN

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics Circular Polarizer Camera Photography Lens - 67 mm
feature_bullets: Circular polarizer--one of the most popular special-effect filters
Deepens the intensity of blue skies; reduces or eliminates glare
Ideal for outdoor photography; for use with auto-focus and non-auto-focus cameras

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars5,775 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
